params.name: ruleName

params.desc: The new priority of the rule

params.desc: The new priority of the rule

params.desc: The new min interval of the rule

rules.name: xsDisableRuleGroup

params.desc: The name of the rule group to disable

rules.desc: Disables all the rules in the given rule group

rules.name: xsIsRuleGroupEnabled

params.name: ruleGroupName

rules.desc: Returns true, if all the rules in the given rule group are enabled

vectors.desc: The Z coordinate of the vector given.

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to set the X coordinate to

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to modify the Y coordinate of

params.name: y
params.desc: The value to set the Y coordinate to

vectors.name: xsVectorSetZ

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to modify the Z coordinate of

params.name: z
params.desc: The value to set the Z coordinate to

vectors.desc: Returns a new vector with the Z component of the given vector changed to the given value. Note: This function DOES NOT modify the vector given as the parameter!

vectors.name: xsVectorSet

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to set the X coordinate to

params.name: y
params.desc: The value to set the Y coordinate to

params.name: z
params.desc: The value to set the Z coordinate to

vectors.desc: Returns a vector with the given X, Y and Z components.

vectors.name: xsVectorLength

params.desc: The vector to calculate the length of

vectors.desc: Returns the length of the given vector.

vectors.name: xsVectorNormalize

vectors.desc: Returns the normalised vector in the direction of the given vector.

maths.name: abs

params.name: x
params.desc: The number to find the absolute value of

maths.desc: Returns the absolute value (magnitude) of the given number.

maths.name: sqrt

params.name: x
params.desc: The number to find the square root of

maths.desc: Returns the square root of the given number.

maths.name: pow

params.name: x
params.desc: The base value

params.name: y
params.desc: The exponenet to raise the base value to

maths.desc: Returns x raised to the power y (x**y).

maths.name: sin

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the sine of

maths.desc: Returns the sine of the angle in radians.

maths.name: cos

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the cosine of

maths.desc: Returns the cosine of the angle in radians

maths.name: tan

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the tangent of

maths.desc: Returns the tangent of the angle in radians

maths.name: asin

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse sine of

maths.desc: Returns the inverse sine (arcsin) of the given value

maths.name: acos

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse cosine of

maths.desc: Returns the inverse cosine (arccos) of the given value

maths.name: atan

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse tangent of

maths.desc: Returns the inverse tangent (arctan) of the given value

maths.name: atan2

params.name: x
params.desc: The X coordinate of the point to find the amplitude of

maths.desc: This is supposed to be the atan2(y, x) function but apparently it only takes one input. ThxDE

general.name: xsGetRandomNumber
general.desc: Returns a random number between 0 and 32766.

general.name: xsGetRandomNumberLH

params.name: low
params.desc: The lower bound for the range for the random number returned (included)

params.name: high
params.desc: The upper bound for the range for the random number returned (excluded)

general.desc: Returns a random number between `low` and `high`

general.name: xsGetRandomNumberMax

params.name: max
params.desc: The upper bound for the range for the random number returned (excluded)

general.desc: Returns a random number between 0 and `max`.

general.name: xsGetPlayerCivilization

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to get the civilization of

general.desc: Returns the civilization ID of the given player. Refer to the [Constant Reference](../constants/#3-civs "Jump to: XS Scriptin > Constant Reference > #3. Civs") for all the different civ IDs. Note that even though currently constants for Poles and Bohemians are missing from the Constants file, they are still present in the game. Poles = 38 and Bohemians = 39

general.name: xsGetPlayerInGame

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: Check if this player is still alive

general.desc: Returns a 1 if the player given is still alive. Returns a 0 if the player given has been eliminated.

general.name: xsGetMapName

params.name: showFileExtension
params.desc: If this is set to true, then the returned name also contains the file extension

general.desc: Returns the name of the map currently being played.

general.name: xsGetMapID
general.desc: Returns the AI map type.

general.name: xsGetMapHeight
general.desc: Returns the Height of the map.

general.name: xsGetMapWidth
general.desc: Returns the Width of the map.

general.name: xsGetVictoryType
general.desc:
Returns an integer corresponding to different victory settings ingame. These are:

 0: Standard

1: Consquest

2: Time Limit

3: Score

4: Custom (scenarios only).

Last Man Standing returns 0 as well.

general.name: xsGetVictoryPlayer
general.desc: Returns the number of the player with the highest score in a normal game. Returns the number of the player who owns 5 relics or has a wonder if standard victory is enabled. In a game like KoTH, returns the number of the player who owns the monument.

general.name: xsGetVictoryTime
general.desc: For game modes like KoTH and other game modes where there is a timer on the screen, it returns the amount of time left in half seconds. meaning if the value returned is 799, it means there are 399.5s remaining

general.name: xsGetPlayerNumberOfTechs

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player whoes technology count is being requested.

general.desc: Returns the number of technologies available to the player in the entire game. Always returns 801 for unmodded games.

general.name: xsPlayerAttribute

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to get the resource of (0 for Gaia)

params.name: resourceID
params.desc: The ID of the resource to get the amount of

general.desc: Returns the amount the specified resource of the given player.

general.name: xsSetPlayerAttribute

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to set the resource of (0 for Gaia)

params.name: resourceID
params.desc: The ID of the resource to set the amount of

params.name: value
params.desc: The amount to set the resource to

general.desc: Sets the amount of the specified resource of the given player to the provided value.

general.name: xsTriggerVariable

params.name: variableID
params.desc: The ID of the variable to get the value of

general.desc: Returns the value of the variable of the given variable ID.

general.name: xsSetTriggerVariable

params.name: variableID
params.desc: The ID of the variable to set the value of

params.name: value
params.desc: The value to set the variable to

general.desc: Sets the value of the variable of the given variable ID to the provided value.

general.name: xsGetNumPlayers
general.desc: Returns the number of players in the game

general.name: xsChatData

params.name: message
params.desc: The message to display in chat

params.name: value
params.desc: This value is inserted in place of any `%d` used in the message of the function

general.desc: Shows the given message in the game chat

general.name: xsGetTime
general.desc: Returns the current game time - 1 in seconds

general.name: xsGetGameTime
general.desc: Returns the current game time in seconds

general.name: xsEffectAmount

params.name: effectID
params.desc: The ID of the effect to use

params.name: unitOrTechnologyID
params.desc: The ID of the unit or technology to effect

params.name: attribtueOrOperation
params.desc: The attribute to modify or the operation to perform

params.name: value
params.desc: The value of the effect

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to apply the effect to. If unspecified, applies to all players except Gaia.

general.desc: Change the specified attribute of the specified unit or technology by the value for the specified player. For more information on this, check the [UserPatch]("Jump to: UserPatch NONE EXISTENT") section of the guide

general.name: xsResearchTechnology

params.name: techID
params.desc: The technology ID to research.

params.name: force
params.desc: Force researching the tech even if it is not enabled. To force an unavailable tech, the argument `techAvailable` must be set to false

params.name: techAvailable
params.desc: This flag determines if it is required to check if a tech is available before researching it

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to research the technology for

general.desc: Returns a boolean based on whether the technology was researched or not.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsDumpArrays
Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: This function is supposed to blogs out all XS arrays. Currently, it does absolutely nothing.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsGetContextPlayer
Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: Returns the current context player ID.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsSetContextPlayer

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to set the context player to

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: In other functions involving a `playerNumber` argument, the value of the context player is used if `-1` is passed as `playerNumber` to them. `xsEffectAmount` will use the value of the context player as its player if `-2` is passed to it as the player argument.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsGetFuntionID

params.name: functionName
params.desc: The name of the function to get the hash of

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: Returns the hash of a given function. This function has no practical application and is probably for internal usage only.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsBreakPoint
Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: This function adds a break point to the execution of code. Do not use this function and beware, if you do, it will likely cause a crash!

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.name: xsAddRuntimeEvent

params.name: runtimeName
params.desc: This is the name of the runtime to create the event in. This should be `"Random Map"` for RMS and `"Scenario Triggers"` for scenarios. Find which one to use in a general script by using the `#!cpp xsGetMapName(true)` [function](./#56-xsgetmapname "Jump To: Function Reference > xsGetMapName") and checking the extension.

params.name: functionName
params.desc: This is the name of a user defined function that takes a single integer argument

params.name: functionArgument
params.desc: This is an integer argument that is passed to the function given to the argument `functionName` when this event runs.

Functions With Seemingly No Practical Us.desc: A runtime event is called after all the XS code has finished executing but before rules start executing. It calls the function `functionName` given to it with the `functionArgument` passed to it as a parameter. For programmers familiar with the terminology, this is basically a way to set a callback. It also returns true if the function name given to it exists, otherwise it returns false. Does not work with built-ins
